meaningMnemonic: This is the noun version of 香, making it have the same meaning, <vocabulary>fragrance</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: The <vocabulary>fragrance</vocabulary> you smell is somebody's <reading>顔</reading> (かお). Just imagine smelling the fragrance of a bunch of people's faces. Yum!
